lines.text: A couple of medieval songwriters come up with the idea of chivalry one rainy day and you embrace it as a lifestyle. You live and die by a code of honor that was *trendy* when you were a kid.
What do you expect? Einstein? Freud? Buddha? Sorry Joe, I'm just a guy.

So I'm a little weak on pop culture. Well, who the hell is Chubby Checker in the grand scheme of things, anyway? I mean I, I know how tall Nero was, Caesar's favorite food, I know Helen of Troy didn't have that great a face and it only launched a hundred ships not a thousand, and...
Blah, blah, blah, blah, blah...

You think it takes courage to do what we do? Face another immortal with a sword knowing only one of you will live. You try being her. You try living one year knowing that your time is running out. That no matter how much you train, no matter how many tricks you have, you STILL lose. That's the way it is for them. So little time for them to SEE anything or DO anything.
You really thought I'd lose?
Yeah. And you didn't?
It wasn't about that. You guys still don't get it, do you?
No.

I had to take responsibility for what I'd done. Nothing you two could do was ever going to solve it for me. I had to face him and fight the best fight of my life knowing he'd do the same. It's just the Fates that decide the winner.
Trial by combat. Whoever survives is proved right in the eyes of the law.
Bright boy.
But what if he comes after you again?
He won't.
How do you know that?
Because I wouldn't.
Well, he's not you.
He's not that different. None of us are. We all make mistakes.
And we all have mistakes to forgive.
Speaking of mistakes, there seems to be an inspector who is determined to put my cute little butt in jail.
Sorry about that.
She won't forgive me?
Oh no, I don't think she should.
I think this is my cue to leave.
Bye Methos.
Bye Methos.
You guys be good.
If not, we'll try to be better.

[with a welding torch in her hand]
I may not be able to kill you, but I'll give you a facial you won't forget.
Last request?
Yeah, I'd like to die of old age.
Do you want a tombstone that says, "He Lived For Centuries" or do you want one that says, "For Centuries He Was Alive"?
You're not listening to me. I don't want a tombstone.
Grab a beer. There's a cold one in the fridge.
I know, it's my fridge.
[Opening narration]

He is immortal. Born in the Highlands of Scotland 400 years ago. He is not alone. There are others like him, some good, some evil. For centuries he has battled the forces of darkness, with holy ground his only refuge. He cannot die, unless you take his head, and with it his power. In the end there can be only one. He is Duncan MacLeod, the Highlander.
[At Methos' apartment. Amanda is banging on the door]
Methos. Open the door. I know you're there. Methos! Methos, it's Amanda.

[opens door]
Do you want to knock a bit louder? I don't think they heard you in Philadelphia.
I'm sorry. It was an emergency, okay?
No, it was a good way to get your head cut off is what it was.
You're turning into an old grouch, aren't you? Or did I interrupt something important?
Amanda, it is the middle of the night and I wasn't expecting anyone. Give me a minute. You want some coffee?
Yeah.
[Referring to Duncan]
He has most of the fun, and all of the good women.
Tell me, how do you handle knowing that one day he's gonna watch you grow old, wrinkle and then die, and eventually move on to somebody else?
Were you born sensitive or did you have to study?
There's a guy watching you, you know.
There usually is.
MacLeod, why don't you believe me?
Experience.
The longer I live the more I get attached to myself.
For 300 years you've been telling me to go legit. Now that I'm straight you want me to steal.
What if I kiss it and make it better?
How much better?
Who the hell are you?
A man who was born long before the age of chivalry. Now pick it up.
I was born before the age of chivalry.
I've just had a thought.
Ooooooo.
He's using your name.
Well, it's not like it's got a patent or anything...
It's not going to work McLeod. I haven't felt guilt since the eleventh century."
[From "The Modern Prometheus"]
My task is done. My song has ceased. My theme has died into an echo... It is fit.
You won't let me change, you know that? You really expect me to steal.
I expect sharks to bite too. Don't take it personally.
[to Joe Dawson]
We ate, we drank, we vomited.
[muttering to himself after being tossed over a stone wall by Duncan]
I'm too old for this.
[after waking, becoming an Immortal]
Mac, I'm alive.
But I want to see *me* live happily ever after even more.
Come on, do it. Come on, come on, go ahead, do it. When the Quickening knocks you on your skinny little ass, MacLeod's gonna be right there to help you up. I die, you go right behind me.
Just because I don't like to fight, doesn't mean that I *can't*.
[to Duncan MacLeod]
Don't go, MacLeod. It's a trap, MacLeod. MacLeod, your pants are on fire.
Then who do we get to wear the kilt?
Mel Gibson.
You know, considering how shot to pieces you were, it's amazing you're still alive.
Ow! Considering who's treating me, I'd say it's a miracle. Watch out. Ow! Where'd you say you studied medicine?
Heidelberg. 1453.
Did you major in medicine or dueling?
Both. A couple more days, you'll be able to travel.
You don't have to look quite so happy about it.
You know that run in you had with the Watchers the other night?
Yeah?
Jean Dumar. He was killed the same night. I'm sorry, Joe. I know he's a friend of yours.
Hey, it was the other Immortal.
Yeah, well you try telling that to Shapiro 'cause he's convinced it was you. Really, guys, the time's come for you two to start a new life somewhere. Bora Bora is very nice this time of year.
Yeah, well send me a postcard. I'm not leaving.
Does the term "self-preservation" mean anything to you, MacLeod? Look, you are under a death sentence!
Yeah, and I will be until they figure out I'm not the killer. Where's Shapiro?
Right at the moment, busy trying to kill you.
Where is Shapiro?
Look, don't make it easy for him, Mac.
Look, I'm making it easy for him because that's where the killer would go. Now where is he?
They're hiding out in a mortuary on the left bank.

He is Duncan MacLeod, the Highlander. Born in 1592 in the Highlands of Scotland and he is still alive. He is immortal. For 400 years he's been a warrior, a lover, a wanderer, constantly facing other immortals in a combat to the death. The winner takes his enemy's head and with it his power. I am a Watcher, part of a secret society of men and women who observe and record, but never interfere. We know the truth about immortals. In the end, there can be only one. May it be Duncan MacLeod, the Highlander.
[Referring to mortals]
THey have so little time to SEE anything or DO anything.
In the end there can be only one, and it might as well be me.
Sometimes in life you have to do more than just watch.
We fight to stay alive. Don't forget to live.
Just how old are you? Are you a Christian, or do you paint yourself blue and bay at the moon?
He says he heard a strange noise, we went to go check it out, and he saw three grown men with drawn swords, having it out.
Did he also see a guy in a bat costume and a long cape?
How do you feel?
Like I left my heart in San Francisco...
Life, my friend, is in the details.
Hitler killed, and Ingrid judged. Breslaw killed, and Ingrid judged. Ingrid killed, and you judged.
So who's left to judge me?
Old Timer. Do you have any words of wisdom?
Nope.
You don't understand, I am the end of time.
You're history.
Smooth. Very, very smooth. I'm takin' notes.
You know, sometimes you knowing everything gets to be a real pain in the ass.
Okay, everybody who's an Immortal, raise their hand.
To... dinner, a film, a concert, a smile, a sunset, a walk, all of the above... whatever you would like.
[to Duncan MacLeod]
Great, you knock me on my bum because I make a bad joke, very macho.
Like you said, I go with the winner.
Talk about the blind leading the visually challenged.
[to Duncan]

You know, I used to stay up at night wondering. Thinking that there must be some special thing I'm supposed to do with my life because I'm Immortal. And I had this illusion that because you were my teacher, that you would show me what it was. And you did. I got it now. There can be only one.
Why do you want to go out with me?
Because the alternative is unthinkable.
I don't sleep with virgins, and I don't kill children.
